alert.note: Alert for Inland Georgetown; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Georgetown and south central Williamsburg Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 658 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lambert, or 19 miles northwest of McClellanville, moving east at 10 to 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain that may lead to temporary localized flooding or ponding across low lying areas. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lambert and Sampit. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
